reasoning: The transcription provides a sequence of actions and ingredients that Jacques Pepin follows to make the dish. By identifying the key actions and ingredients mentioned, we can outline the cooking steps. The steps are extracted based on the order of actions described, such as sauting, adding liquids, boiling, and seasoning.
dish_description: Pasta vasoule (likely a variation of pasta e fagioli) is an Italian specialty consisting of pasta and beans in a rich and savory broth, finished with Parmesan cheese and herbs.

cooking_steps.description: Start by heating a couple of tablespoons of good olive oil in a pot.
Add about 3/4 cup of pancetta (unsmoked bacon) to the pot and saut.
Chop a good cup of onion and add it to the pot with the pancetta.
Crush 3 cloves of garlic to make about a tablespoon of chopped garlic and add it to the pot.
Cook the mixture for 2 to 3 minutes until it starts browning.
Pour in a cup and a half of chicken stock and a cup and a quarter of a mixture of diced tomato and puree of tomato. Season with at least half a teaspoon of salt and half a teaspoon of ground pepper.
Drain a can of cannelloni beans and add them to the pot, along with some of the bean juice if desired.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then add a good cup of penne pasta (about 4 ounces). Cover and continue boiling until the pasta is cooked, about 20 minutes.
Once the pasta is cooked, enrich the dish with a tablespoon or so of butter and a couple of tablespoons of chives or parsley.
Bring the dish back to a boil, check for seasoning, and adjust with more salt and pepper if needed.
Serve the pasta vasoule with Parmesan cheese on top and maybe a little extra green for garnish.
